bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

div1.p: Moseley's bibliography, sent to Carter by Noble, lists 18th and early 19th century articles about tropical medicine.

div1.head: Bibliography by Benjamin Moseley, [1924]
div1.p:
Observations on the dysentery of the West Indies, with a new and
successful method of treating it. 24pp., 8°., Jamaica, etc., 1781.

A treatise on tropical diseases and on the climate of the West Indies.
544 pp. 1787, 2nd Ed. with title added: A treatise on tropical diseases
on military operations, and on the climate of the West Indies, 1787. The
same, 3rd Ed., 1792-&95. 4th ed. 1803.

A treatise concerning the properties and effects of coffee. 5th ed., 80 pp.
Lond., 1792.

Medical tracts, 1 on sugar 2 on the cow pox, 3 on Yaws, 4 on Obi, or
African witchcraft, 5 on plague, and yellow fever of America, 6 on
hospitals, 7 on bronchocele, 8 on prisons. 2nd ed. with considerable
additions. 276 pp., 8°., Lond., 1800, 2nd ed. 1804.

A treatise on the lues bovilla, or cow-pox. 142 pp. 8°., Lond., 1805,
100 pp., 1804.
Commentaries on the lues bovilla or cow pox, 184 pp., 8°., Lond., 1806.

On Hydrophobia, its prevention and cure with a dissertation on canine
madness illustrated with cases. 5th ed. 74 pp., 8°., Lond., 1809.

Vaccine (La) combattue dans le pays ou elle a pris naissance, ou tra-
duction de trois ouvrages anglais, etc., xxx 2° Discussion historique
et critique sur la vaccine, par le docteur Moseley; x x x 290 pp., 8°.,
Paris, 1807.

Observations on the properties and effects of coffee. 38 pp., 8°., Lond.,
1785.

A review of the report of the Royal College of Physicians of Lond., on
vaccination. 86 pp., 8°., Lond., 1808.
